abstract_summ: A total of 88 ASA I-II patients requiring nasotracheal intubation for elective dental surgery with normal airways were divided into two groups according to head position, neutral position, and sniffing position . The optimal head position for GlideScope facilitated nasotraraction has not yet been determined . The C-MAC D-Blade videolaryngoscope is an effective tool for NTI in a simulated difficult airway .
